title: Moonshadow, Moonshadow
summary: The Moon casts shadows on itself and on Earth, environmental concerns overshadow a test launch’s success, and exoplanets are awesome (beyond a shadow of a doubt).

title: What happened with Psyche?
summary: When the Psyche mission missed its launch date in 2022, it caused a ripple-effect of delays and budget woes for other JPL-led missions. Dr. Laurie Leshin, JPL's new director, shares her insights into the unique challenges facing her team and what she's doing to change JPL for the better.

title: Have a nice flight!
summary: Flying on Titan is easy, but not as easy as flying on Deimos. Plus, Juice takes off and Ingenuity captures a view from the air.

title: The phases of the Moon explained
summary: Your guide to the phases of the Moon, their names, and why they happen.

title: Resilient Space: A Defense in Depth
Rocket flight and the five dwarfs
summary: Meet the Solar System’s five official dwarf planets, celebrate two major launches, and find out why planets sometimes seem to go backwards across the sky.

title: SpaceX's Starship test flight succeeds despite not reaching orbit
summary: The test flight succeeded in its goal of having the two vehicles clear the launch tower, although they exploded before reaching orbit.

title: 2023 Digital Day of Action recap
summary: The Planetary Society's all-virtual advocacy event was a success, with more than 1,500 advocacy actions taken.

title: What does “Mercury in retrograde” actually mean?
summary: "Mercury in retrograde" is one of the most searched terms relating to the planet. Astrological interpretations aside, apparent retrograde motion is an interesting phenomenon that has to do with orbital speeds and observer perspective.

title: Meet the Solar System's five official dwarf planets
summary: The International Astronomical Union currently recognizes five dwarf planets: Ceres, Pluto, Haumea, Makemake, and Eris.
